H0.text: when does a cell have condensed visible chromosomes also known as sister chromatids. Prophase

H1.text: when does a cell have condensed visible chromosomes also known as sister chromatids. Anaphase

H2.text: when does a cell have condensed visible chromosomes also known as sister chromatids. Telophase

H3.text: when does a cell have condensed visible chromosomes also known as sister chromatids. metaphase

A4.text: DNA that was replicated in interphase is condensed from DNA strands with lengths reaching 0.7 μm down to 0.2-0.3 μm.

A5.text: During both meiotic and mitotic prophase, giemsa staining can be applied to cells to elicit G-banding in chromosomes.
